feed.title: Google Cloud: Spanner
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Spanner

entry.content:
Spanner offers a predefined library of over 80 MySQL functions that you can install in a database. These functions let you perform operations that are common in the MySQL environments directly with Spanner. They can help reduce the changes required when migrating workloads from MySQL to Spanner.

These functions are packaged as user-defined functions that can be installed from an open-source DDL script hosted on GitHub. For more information, see Install MySQL functions in Spanner.
entry.summary: Spanner now supports over 80 MySQL functions to simplify migration and operations.
entry.title: Feature: New MySQL functions in Spanner

entry.content: Columnar engine for Spanner is now in Preview. Columnar engine is a storage technique used with analytics queries to speed up scans. Spanner columnar engine accelerates analytical query performance on live operational data by up to 200 times without affecting transaction workloads. This eliminates the need for ETL into separate data warehouses while maintaining strong consistency. For more information, see the Columnar engine for Spanner overview.
entry.summary: Spanner columnar engine speeds up analytics on live data.
entry.title: Feature: Spanner Adds New Feature

entry.content:
When you create the free trial instance using the Google Cloud console, Spanner creates and preloads it with a sample database for an ecommerce store. You can use the free trial instance to explore the dataset and learn about Spanner capabilities with pre-loaded queries.

For more information, see Spanner free trial instances.
entry.summary: Explore Spanner with a free trial instance, preloaded with an e-commerce sample database and queries.
entry.title: Feature: Spanner Free Trial Instance

entry.content: You can use continuous queries to export BigQuery data into Spanner in real time. This feature is in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Real-time BigQuery to Spanner Export

entry.content: Spanner Data Boost supports data stored on hard disk drives (HDD). This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Spanner Data Boost, now generally available, supports data stored on hard disk drives (HDD).
entry.title: Feature: Spanner Data Boost supports HDDs

entry.content: The performance of the ANY and the ANY SHORTEST algorithms have been improved. These algorithms are used to find Spanner Graph paths. For more information, see ANY and ANY SHORTEST paths.
entry.summary: The performance of the ANY and ANY SHORTEST algorithms, used for finding Spanner Graph paths, has been improved.
entry.title: Changed: Performance improvements for ANY and ANY SHORTEST algorithms

entry.content:
Spanner supports the following new client-side metrics to the Spanner API frontend (AFE) and Google frontend (GFE) for Java and Go applications:

  • AFE connectivity error count
  • AFE latencies
  • GFE connectivity error count
  • GFE latencies

These metrics can be used with server-side metrics to enable faster troubleshooting of performance and latency issues. For more information, see Client-side metrics descriptions.
entry.summary: New client-side metrics for Java and Go applications are now available for the Spanner API, providing AFE and GFE connectivity error counts and latencies. These metrics, when used with server-side data, can help in diagnosing performance and latency issues more effectively.
entry.title: Feature: New Client-Side Metrics for Spanner

entry.content: To troubleshoot or understand your Spanner queries better, you can download and save your query execution plan as a JSON file. You can now use the content of this file to see a visualization of the query execution plan in Spanner Studio. For more information, see Take a tour of the query plan visualizer.
entry.summary: You can now visualize your Spanner query execution plan with a JSON file download, making it easier to troubleshoot and understand your queries.
entry.title: Feature: Spanner Query Execution Plan Visualization

entry.content: You can directly connect and interact with your Spanner database using the Spanner CLI, an interactive shell for Spanner that is built into the Google Cloud CLI. You can use the Spanner CLI to start an interactive session and automate SQL executions from the shell or an input file. This feature is available in Preview. For more information, see Spanner CLI quickstart.
entry.summary: Interact with your Spanner database using the Spanner CLI, a new feature built into the Google Cloud CLI. You can use this tool to start interactive sessions and automate SQL executions.
entry.title: Feature: Spanner CLI available in preview

entry.content: A new free trial creation work flow makes it easier to start your Spanner free trial. With a free trial instance, you can learn and explore Spanner for 90 days at no cost. You can create relational (GoogleSQL and PostgreSQL) databases and deploy NoSQL models (Spanner Graph, Vector search, and Full-text search) in a single, fully managed database. For more information, see Spanner free trial instances overview.
entry.summary: Easily start your Spanner free trial with our new workflow. Explore Spanner for 90 days at no cost, supporting both relational and NoSQL models in a single, managed database.
entry.title: Feature: New Spanner Free Trial Workflow

entry.content: Column operations statistics are generally available. They help you get insights into and monitor the usage of columns in your database. For more information, see Column operations statistics.
entry.summary: Get insights into and monitor your database column usage with the new column operations statistics feature.
entry.title: Feature: Column Operations Statistics Now Available

entry.content: BigQuery now supports using Spanner external datasets with authorized views, authorized routines, and Cloud resource connections. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery now supports Spanner external datasets with authorized views, authorized routines, and Cloud resource connections. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery adds Spanner external datasets support

entry.content: Spanner now supports cross regional federated queries from BigQuery, which allows BigQuery users to query Spanner tables from regions other than their BigQuery region. Users will not incur any Spanner network egress charges during the preview period. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery users can now query Spanner tables in different regions. No Spanner network egress charges apply during the preview period.
entry.title: Feature: Cross-region queries for Spanner
